verse_text: And climbing into a boat, he crossed the sea, and he arrived at his own city
And behold, they brought to him a paralytic, lying on a bed. And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, â€œBe strengthened in faith, son; your sins are forgiven you.
And behold, some of the scribes said within themselves, â€œHe is blaspheming.
And when Jesus had perceived their thoughts, he said: â€œWhy do you think such evil in your hearts
Which is easier to say, â€˜Your sins are forgiven you,â€™ or to say, â€˜Rise up and walk?
But, so that you may know that the Son of man has authority on earth to forgive sins,â€ he then said to the paralytic, â€œRise up, take up your bed, and go into your house.
And he arose and went into his house
Then the crowd, seeing this, was frightened, and they glorified God, who gave such power to men
And when Jesus passed on from there, he saw, sitting at the tax office, a man named Matthew. And he said to him, â€œFollow me.â€ And rising up, he followed him
And it happened that, as he was sitting down to eat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners arrived, and they sat down to eat with Jesus and his disciples
And the Pharisees, seeing this, said to his disciples, â€œWhy does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?
But Jesus, hearing this, said: â€œIt is not those who are healthy who are in need of a physician, but those who have maladies
So then, go out and learn what this means: â€˜I desire mercy and not sacrifice.â€™ For I have not come to call the just, but sinners.
Then the disciples of John drew near to him, saying, â€œWhy do we and the Pharisees fast frequently, but your disciples do not fast?
And Jesus said to them: â€œHow can the sons of the groom mourn, while the groom is still with them? But the days will arrive when the groom will be taken away from them. And then they shall fast
For no one would sew a patch of new cloth onto an old garment. For it pulls its fullness away from the garment, and the tear is made worse

Neither do they pour new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wineskins rupture, and the wine pours out, and the wineskins are destroyed. Instead, they pour new wine into new wineskins. And so, both are preserved.

As he was speaking these things to them, behold, a certain ruler approached and adored him, saying: â€œLord, my daughter has recently passed away. But come and impose your hand upon her, and she will live.
And Jesus, rising up, followed him, with his disciples
And behold, a woman, who had suffered from a flow of blood for twelve years, approached from behind and touched the hem of his garment
For she said within herself, â€œIf I will touch even his garment, I shall be saved.
But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said: â€œBe strengthened in faith, daughter; your faith has made you well.â€ And the woman was made well from that hour
And when Jesus had arrived in the house of the ruler, and he had seen the musicians and the tumultuous crowd
he said, â€œDepart. For the girl is not dead, but asleep.â€ And they derided him
And when the crowd had been sent away, he entered. And he took her by the hand. And the girl rose up
And the news of this went out to that entire land
And as Jesus passed from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, â€œTake pity on us, Son of David.
And when he had arrived at the house, the blind men approached him. And Jesus said to them, â€œDo you trust that I am able to do this for you?â€ They say to him, â€œCertainly, Lord.
Then he touched their eyes, saying, â€œAccording to your faith, so let it be done for you.
And their eyes were opened. And Jesus warned them, saying, â€œSee to it that no one knows of this.
But going out, they spread the news of it to all that land
Then, when they had departed, behold, they brought him a man who was mute, having a demon
And after the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. And the crowds wondered, saying, â€œNever has anything like this been seen in Israel.
But the Pharisees said, â€œBy the prince of demons does he cast out demons.
And Jesus traveled throughout all of the cities and towns, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the Gospel of the kingdom, and healing every illness and every infirmity
Then, seeing the multitudes, he had compassion on them, because they were distressed and were reclining, like sheep without a shepherd
Then he said to his disciples: â€œThe harvest indeed is great, but the laborers are few
Therefore, petition the Lord of the harvest, so that he may sent out laborers to his harvest.
